item.itunes:author: Empire
item.itunes:subtitle: We talk Contraband, We Bought A Zoo, 21 Jump Street, as well as the return of Braveheart and Clint Eastwood.

item.title: Empire Podcast #4: March 23, 2012
item.itunes:author: Empire
item.itunes:subtitle: Terence Stamp and Peter Lord interviews; we talk Pirates!, The Hunger Games and Wild Bill.
item.itunes:summary: For our bumper-sized fourth episode, we discuss Nathan Fillion's God-like status, Jack Ryan's possible return and Tim Burton's Dark Shadows - and hear some wise words from Aardman co-founder Peter Lord, as well as General Zod himself, Terence Stamp. Not forgetting our reviews of this week's releases, including The Pirates! In An Adventure With Scientists, The Hunger Games and Wild Bill.
item.itunes:keywords: film, movies, Empire, Peter Lord, Terence Stamp, The Hunger Games, Wild Bill, film podcast, Pirates! In An Adventure With Scientists, Empire Magazine, Dark Shadows

item.title: Empire Podcast #5: March 30, 2012
item.itunes:author: Empire
item.itunes:subtitle: We review Wrath Of The Titans and StreetDance 2 3D, discuss Anchorman 2 and The Jameson Empire Awards, and Dexter Fletcher and Jason Flemyng pop in to talk about Wild Bill.
item.itunes:summary: The fifth episode of The Empire Podcast sees Chris Hewitt, Nick de Semlyen, Helen O'Hara and pod debutant, Dan Jolin, discuss the big news of the week, including Anchorman 2 and The Jameson Empire Awards, and review Wrath Of The Titans and StreetDance 2 3D. Also, Wild Bill's Dexter Fletcher and Jason Flemyng drop in for a frank and funny chat.
item.itunes:keywords: film, movies, Empire, Wild Bill, Dexter Fletcher, Jason Flemyng, Anchorman 2, film podcast, Jameson Empire Awards, Empire Magazine, Wrath Of The Titans

item.title: Empire Podcast - Terence Stamp Special
item.itunes:author: Empire
item.itunes:subtitle: A very special, interview-only Terence Stamp podcast from Empire Magazine.
item.itunes:summary: In last week's podcast - Empire Podcast #4 - we included about 15 minutes of our hour-long Terence Stamp interview. Here we've got the whole thing, complete with the former General's anecdotes on Marlon Brando, being approached in saunas and his tantric guru phase. You'll see what we mean...
item.itunes:keywords: film, movies, Empire, film podcast, Empire Magazine, superman, superman 2, superman II

item.itunes:author: Empire
item.itunes:subtitle: We talk Titanic 3D and Headhunters, as well as Ashton Kutcher's upcoming Steve Jobs biopic and the return of Woody Allen.
item.itunes:summary: The sixth episode of The Empire Podcast sees Chris Hewitt, Helen O'Hara, Ali Plumb and Phil De Semlyen discuss the big news of the week, including Ashton Kutcher playing Steve Jobs and the return of Woody Allen on screen, as well as reviewing Headhunters and Titanic 3D. Also, Battleship's Peter Berg, Taylor Kitsch and Brooklyn Decker pop round to say hello.
item.itunes:keywords: empire podcast, empire magazine, film, cinema, movies, movie reviews, film reviews,titanic, titanic 3d, headhunters, woman in black, film podcast, braveheart

item.title: Empire Podcast #7: April 13, 2012
item.itunes:author: Empire
item.itunes:subtitle: We talk Battleship and The Cabin In The Woods, as well as Prometheus preview footage and Gary Ross leaving the Hunger Games series.
item.itunes:summary: For our seventh episode, we discuss cheesey action movie one-liners, Gary Ross leaving the Hunger Games franchise and first 10 minutes of Prometheus - and hear some wise words from Mike Newell on La Grande Illusion, as well as The Cabin In The Woods director Drew Goddard on, um, The Cabin In The Woods . Not forgetting our reviews of this week's releases, including The Battleship and - would you believe it? - The Cabin In The Woods.
item.itunes:keywords: empire podcast, empire magazine, film, cinema, movies, movie reviews, film reviews, the cabin in the woods, battleship, prometheus, la grande illusion, mike newell, drew goddard

item.title: Empire Podcast - The Cabin In The Woods Drew Goddard Spoiler Special
item.itunes:author: Empire
item.itunes:subtitle: Watched The Cabin In The Woods? Then boy do we have a podcast for you...
item.itunes:summary: Watched The Cabin In The Woods? Wish you could have talked to the director / co-writer afterward? Well, we can't offer you that, but we can offer you this special, eight minute or so mini-podcast with Drew Goddard - so as long as you've definitely, absolutely, 100% watched the film, then enjoy this exceptionally spoilery super special edition of the Empire Podcast.
item.itunes:keywords: film, movies, Empire, film podcast, cabin in the woods, spoiler, spoilers, drew goddard, joss whedon

item.itunes:keywords: film, movies, Empire, film podcast, guy pearce, lockout, salmon fishing in the yemen, marley, bob marley, sin city, sin city2, empire magazine, movie podcast

item.title: Empire Podcast - Mike Newell Special
item.itunes:author: Empire
item.itunes:subtitle: Mike Newell comes in for a very frank chat about his career, La Grande Illusion and, um, swearing.
item.itunes:summary: Mike Newell is the man behind Four Weddings And A Funeral, Donnie Brasco, Harry Potter And The Goblet of Fire and many more - and recently, he came into the Empire office to talk about his favourite film ever, La Grande Illusion. But after that, he spent some time with us chatting about the rest of his career... and Johnny Depp's unusual activities on set. You'll have to listen through to see what we mean, to be honest. Anyway, here's the resulting mega podcast, just for you. Enjoy!
item.itunes:keywords: film, movies, Empire, film podcast, movie podcast, mike newell, donnie brasco, four weddings and a funeral, johnny depp, al pacino, prince of persia

item.title: Empire Podcast #9: April 27, 2012
item.itunes:author: Empire
item.itunes:subtitle: We talk Iron Man 3 and James Cameron taking over the world, as well as Avengers Assemble, Damsels In Distress and Being Elmo. Plus Marvel's Kevin Feige drops by.
item.itunes:summary: For our ninth episode, we discuss why James Cameron should rule the world, Pixar's 'Day Of The Dead' movie and Iron Man 3's casting news - alongside reviews of this week's releases, including Avengers Assemble, Damsels In Distress and Being Elmo. Oh, and Marvel head honcho Kevin Feige drops by to give us some pretty interesting Iron Man 3 details, and American Pie: Reunion's Eugene Levy and Jennifer Coolidge come round to compliment our microphones. For some reason.
item.itunes:keywords: empire podcast, empire magazine, film, cinema, movies, movie reviews, film reviews, avengers, avengers assemble, kevin feige, eugene levy, american pie, being elmo, damsels in distress, marvel

item.title: Empire Podcast - The Avengers Kevin Feige Spoiler Special
item.itunes:author: Empire
item.itunes:subtitle: Empire talks Avengers Assemble in this special, spoiler-filled podcast with Marvel head Kevin Feige.
item.itunes:summary: Watched The Avengers and wish you could find out more about it? Well then, it's about time you listened to Empire spoiler-filled Avengers podcast, starring Marvel Studio's head honcho himself, Kevin Feige. So if you're 100% sure you've watched The Avengers already, don't click anything else but play. That's an order, soldier.
item.itunes:keywords: empire podcast, empire magazine, film, cinema, movies, movie reviews, film reviews, avengers, avengers assemble, kevin feige, marvel, spoilers, spoiler, spoiler podcast

item.itunes:author: Empire
item.itunes:subtitle: We talk Safe, The Lucky One, Game Of Thrones, American Pie: Reunion and the on-going box office success of The Avengers.

Some of that 'much, much more' includes reviews of this week's releases - think American Pie: Reunion, Safe and The Lucky One - as well as Game Of Thrones author George RR Martin dropping by for one of the nerdiest chats of all time.
item.itunes:keywords: empire podcast, empire magazine, film, cinema, movies, movie reviews, film reviews, game of thrones, avengers, avengers assemble, safe, jason statham, mark ruffalo, the hulk, joss whedon

item.itunes:subtitle: We talk Kick-Ass 2, Avatar 4 and Avengers 2, and, as they say, much, much more, including reviews, more news and a chat with Edgar Wright.

item.itunes:author: Empire
item.itunes:subtitle: Edgar Wright, the man behind Spaced, Hot Fuzz and Shaun Of The Dead, comes round for a good old chat about pretty much everything and anything.

item.itunes:subtitle: We talk The Dictator and The Raid, and, as they say, much, much more, including news, your queries and a chat with Wes Anderson and Barry Sonnenfeld - separately, mind.

item.itunes:keywords: empire podcast, empire magazine, film, cinema, movies, movie reviews, film reviews, wes anderson, men in black, barry sonnefeld

item.itunes:subtitle: We talk Men In Black 3 and Moonrise Kingdom, and much, much more besides, including news, your queries and a chat with Gareth Evans.

item.title: Empire Podcast #14: June 1, 2012 - Rick McCallum
item.itunes:author: Empire
item.itunes:subtitle: We talk GI Joe 2 getting delayed, One Shot getting renamed, the arrival of Snow White And The Huntsman, The Angels' Share and a little film called Prometheus.
item.itunes:summary: For our fourteenth podcast, we tackle the tricky topics of One Shot becoming Jack Reacher, GI Joe 2 getting pushed back until 2013 and a little sci-fi you might have heard of called Prometheus. The Angels' Share and Snow White And The Huntsman also end up on the reviewing griddle, and the enormously entertaining Lucasfilm producer Rick McCallum drops by for a fantastically frank chat.
item.itunes:keywords: empire podcast, empire magazine, film, cinema, movies, movie reviews, film reviews, prometheus, ridley scott, tom cruise, one shot, ken loach

item.title: Empire Podcast - Neil Marshall Game Of Thrones Special
item.itunes:author: Empire
item.itunes:subtitle: The Centurion, Dog Soldier and The Descent director talks to us about helming the HBO show for just one episode - but what an episode...
item.itunes:summary: Call yourself a Game Of Thrones fan? Watched all the episodes so far? Then we have a podcast you're going to enjoy really rather a lot. Director of the ninth episode in the second season - that's Blackwater, by the way - Neil Marshall dropped by to talk about how he handled stepping in at the last moment, and even tells us a few things about previous projects (like Centurion, Dog Soldier and The Descent) as well as upcoming plans...
item.itunes:keywords: empire podcast, empire magazine, film, cinema, movies, movie reviews, film reviews, game of thrones, neil marshall

item.title: Empire Podcast #15: June 8, 2012 - Simon Pegg, Crispian Mills And Robert Weide
item.itunes:author: Empire
item.itunes:subtitle: Simon Pegg, Crispian Mills and Robert Weide drop by for a chat, and we talk this this week's movie news and reviews.
item.itunes:summary: The fifteenth Empire podcast boasts not one, not two, but three interviewees, namely the director and star of A Fantastic Fear Of Everything - Crispian Mills and Simon Pegg - and the man behind Woody Allen: A Documentary, Robert Weide. Pegg tells us a little bit about Star Trek 2, The World's End and Nick Frost's dance moves, while Weide delivers an Allen impersonation that'll knock your socks off. Elsewhere, we've got plenty of movie news and reviews for you to enjoy, not to mention the podcast debut of the one and only Ian Freer.
item.itunes:keywords: empire podcast, empire magazine, film, cinema, movies, movie reviews, film reviews,simon pegg, robert weide, crispian mills, a fantastic fear of everything, woody allen

item.itunes:keywords: empire podcast, empire magazine, film, cinema, movies, movie reviews, film reviews, robert weide, woody allen

item.itunes:subtitle: Empire heads to San Diego for Comic-Con and interviews with Dredd himself, Karl Urban And Elysium director Neill Blomkamp.
item.itunes:summary: On today's edition, our crack team - Nick de Semlyen, Chris Hewitt and James White - discuss everything they saw, heard, did and smelled at the 'Con today. And that includes (deep breath) panels for The Walking Dead, spoiling the comic's 100th issue for Jonathan Ross, Resident Evil: Retribution, The Big Bang Theory, Looper, Total Recall, Game Of Thrones, Marvel's Item 47 short and the first look at Neill Blomkamp's new film, Elysium.

item.itunes:author: Empire
item.itunes:subtitle: Empire heads to San Diego for Comic-Con and interviews with Guillermo del Toro and Lord of the Rings legend, Richard Taylor.
item.itunes:summary: Sorry for the delay, folks, but at long last we can announce that the third and final part of this year's Comic-Con Daily Podcast Specials is online, for your listening pleasure. And it's quite a doozy as well. Not only do Chris Hewitt, Nick de Semlyen and Jaime Blanco dissect the busiest, biggest day in the history of the 'Con, when the likes of Pacific Rim, Man Of Steel, Iron Man 3 and The Hobbit all graced Hall H, but we talk to Guillermo del Toro and Lord of the Rings legend, Richard Taylor.
item.itunes:keywords: empire podcast, empire magazine, empire, film magazine, film podcast, comic-con, comic con, Guillermo del Toro, Richard Taylor

item.title: Empire Podcast #24: August 17, 2012 - Len Wiseman And Robert Webb
item.itunes:author: Empire

Elsewhere, the silver-tongued Anthony Stewart Head is grilled by our own Buffy buffs about his latest, Percy Jackson: Sea Of Monsters, touching on everything from 'squirrel pants' to putting ice cubes in your mouth before you kiss someone. On top of all that, there's a whole load of very important movie news this week - Inbetweeners 2! Expendables 3! Films that aren't sequels! - for you to catch up on, as well as a look forward to Toronto and Venice, plus our review of the critically-contentious blockbuster The Lone Ranger.
